isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 3.5: CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - CRUISE CONTROL, PTO, HAND THROTTLE SYSTEM - ECM DIAGNOSTICS - SCCS DIAGNOSTICS

svcprocinfo.para: The ECM monitors the signal on SCCS circuit 97AC for the expected five signals discussed earlier. If a signal is detected by the ECM that does not match any one of the five expected signals, then Flash Code 221 is set and the PTO or Cruise is disabled.

svcsubproc.title: FLASH CODE 221 - ATA CODE SID 244 FMI 2 - ECM: SCCS SWITCH OR CIRCUIT FAULT
svcsubproc.para: CAUSES: Open, short (HIGH or LOW), or bias high or low in SCCS circuits or components.
The ECM monitors the R-APS signal input at ECM terminal 30 from the remote pedal sensor for out-of-range signals, high or low.

item.para: Biased High Or Low - A wiring or component defect that changes the circuit resistance (corroded switch contacts, poor connections, dirty or corroded terminals etc.) will alter the signal, causing the code to be set.
A short to a 12V or 5V circuit will change the expected signal.
A short to ground changes the expected signal.

svcsubproc.para:
CORRECTIVE ACTION: Perform Testing SCCS Circuits ( Figure 3.147, 3.148, 3.149, 3.150 and 3.151
).
